messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

LGTM

I can't believe you have to tell gcc to do this if it's faster.

It probably can be made the default via some compile time incantation which
distros don't include.
On 30 Dec 2012 06:26, "minux" <minux.ma@gmail.com> wrote:

>
> On Sunday, December 30, 2012, Russ Cox wrote:
>>
>> I can't believe you have to tell gcc to do this if it's faster.
>>
> it seems gcc still supports assemblers that insist on having a regular
> assembly file as input, but -pipe really should be default at least on
> various unixes.
>

On Sunday, December 30, 2012, Russ Cox wrote:
>
> I can't believe you have to tell gcc to do this if it's faster.
>
it seems gcc still supports assemblers that insist on having a regular
assembly file as input, but -pipe really should be default at least on
various unixes.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=84f88ed1dd63 ***

cmd/dist: use -pipe during bootstrap

R=golang-dev, minux.ma, rsc
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/7025044

subject: code review 7025044: cmd/dist: use -pipe during bootstrap
